holdings.text: The High Court under Art. 226 is not precluded from deciding questions of fact raised in the petition where not complicated, and no interference with its discretion

anchor.surface_text: Under Art. 226 of the Constitution the High Court is number precluded from entering on upon a decision on quests s of fact raised by the petition. Where an enquiry into companyplicated questions of fact arises...

holdings.text: Duty to act judicially arises from the nature of the function if it decides to the prejudice of a person, implicit in such power
holdings.reasoning_summary: Power to adversely affect rights imposes judicial duty without explicit statute; tails of justice ignored make order nullity under rule of law
